intro: Cacalia rigiophylla, commonly known as the rigid-leaf cacalia, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features slender, upright stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are typically covered in a fine layer of hair. Its flowers are small and yellow, arranged in a disc-like structure surrounded by pale green bracts. Cacalia rigiophylla is often found in rocky or alpine habitats, where it thrives in cool, moist conditions.
